TextData.eng: Tadshi: If I’m dead, why does everything still hurt? A corpse shouldn’t feel pain.
Yokai: Ah, because you are not dead, friend.
Tadashi: So my splattered blood and fall from Mt. Fukaido was all a farce, then? I get it, I lost, I’ll pay my penance now.
Yokai: No, that all was very much real. You did lose, and you did die. I have pulled you from the aether beyond, and instilled you with the light of life once more.
Tadashi: Pulled from Yomi’s gates? Why?
Yokai: There is too much unspent potential in your heart.
Tadashi: Yeah, everyone saw so much potential in me. And look what happened.
Tadashi: I defied one of the Shogun’s orders, refused to kill my own sensei, and that bastard cast me out for it!
Tadashi: Exiled, then stabbed through the heart in my failure for revenge.
Tadashi: Not sure which is worse.
Yokai: You failed, yes. But now you are reformed, remade. You are better than you were before, and still may yet be better than what you are now.
Tadashi: Spare me the wise mantra, spirit.
Yokai: Whether you accept your calling for vengeance against the man who wronged you, or return to the quiet life you once knew, you are now blessed with my Luciferin.
Tadashi: What in Yomi’s rot is Luciferin?
Yokai: It is the lifeblood of my light, and what powers your new weapon.
Tadashi: What new weapon?
Tadashi: What the-
Tadashi: This power… this radiance…
Yokai: Impressive, isn’t it? Though due to its nature, you must use it responsibly.
Yokai: Find my fireflies around you, use them to charge the weapon, and use it to strike true when it matters most.
Yokai: Now go and begin your journey. There is someone waiting just outside this grove that I think you’ll be happy to test your newfound power on.
